name: Hilton Moscow Leningradskaya

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with the Hotel. The room was a good size and very clean and tastefully decorated, the bed was comfortable. The Hotel decor was in good condition. The staff all spoke english and were very helpful. Not what I expected to find, given other reviews I had read for hotels in Moscow. There was a money change ATM in the foyer set at the government exchange rate. The room service menu was very reasonably priced, and the breakfast buffet was up to the standard you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The hotel is situated close to the metro, and is an easy few stops from the centre of the city's main attractions. We used the hotel driver for our transfers, but this was VERY expensive, and we would use a taxi cab from the airport in future. (just look for the certified drivers with the yellow and black cards)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with Very Good Service

reviews.text: Positive points :
reviews.title: One of the best hilton ever tried

reviews.text: - Very impressive buiding
reviews.title: Best Hilton Hotel in Eastern Europe -

reviews.text: - Nice spa (good swimming pool and gym ok)
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE HOTEL - not an ideal location but manageable

reviews.text: - Very good breakfast
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Hilton hotels are often pretty boring as most chain hotels even so they are on the luxury side. The Hilton Moscow is a different story. The hotel is nestled in a very charming heritage building, where you can feel Russian bohemian. Don’t get me wrong- rooms, bathrooms and public areas where on par nowadays needs. Check in took a few minutes as they need to register foreigner, but done with a smile. The Lobby is really impressive and charming. I got a room on the 5th floor with two comfy beds, a huge bathroom with tub and separate shower. The pool is located in the basement- nothing really exceptional but good to have. Nothing really to complain about the basics so far, but Internet access is far to pricey @960RUB for 24hours and there is no turn down service.
reviews.title: A Hilton with charm!

reviews.text: I had breakfast twice in Janus restaurant, which was very nice as the style of the restaurant is different to any other modern 5 star chain hotel as it is the whole hotel. There is a huge variety to choose from, witch eggs made to order, pastries, cold cuts, fresh fruits e.g. all of a high quality and service is friendly and quick.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Hotel Hilton in Moscow
reviews.text: To sum up, I really enjoyed my stay @ the Hilton Moscow and would consider to stay there again.

I have stayed here on a number of occasions and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I don't normally like to stay in Hilton's but this one is very good. The rooms are very clean, spacious and quiet. I have never eaten here so I couldn't comment on the food. I would recommend it.
reviews.title: A Hotel to do some business in good conditions...
Business + Holiday
reviews.text: Very nice location and accommodation. Very clean and accessible to a lot of places we want to see and explore
I was there shortly after the opening of this hotel, so I hope that meanwhile the service has improved.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, poor service.

reviews.text: Staff hardly understand English, they say "Yes Yes" but they don't mean it. So be ready to receive something very different from what you order.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Room service arrived at least 45 minutes after placing the order, and each time something different from my order arrived.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel with Great Staff

reviews.text: TV channels available were only Russian.
reviews.title: grandeur, but approachable and friendly

reviews.text: Not sure how they wash laundry either as they ruined my suit.
reviews.title: Very good stay in Moscow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel , great style ( lobby etc ) . Rooms perfect , very comfortable beds .
reviews.title: Good, but............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was excellant but way to expensive , and staff in restaurant very freindly . Over all the staff were pleasant and efficient . We asked concierge to book the train to St P for us which they did , but i think there was a hefty commission involved.
reviews.title: Great experience; even by Hilton standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet was ridiculous cost, we must have internet access and i object to paying a lot of money for something that is actually "free " . The hotel in St Petersburg provided free internet in our room, 24/ 7.
reviews.title: incredibly helpful staff

reviews.text: Two cafe lattes in the lobby was 18 euro ............
reviews.title: Unique Hilton

reviews.text: The location was good for us for the train to St Petersburg and for metro, but if i was advising people going to Moscow for a tourist visit i would suggest a hotel near Red Sq , there are many around there and actually cheaper.
reviews.title: very comfortable and nice hotel

description: Famous landmark, the Hilton Moscow Leningradskaya Hotel is located in one of the legendary Stalin Towers. The highest level of modern comfort and latest technology tastefully complements magnificent historic design with its bronze chandeliers and statues, carved wooden panels and frescos. Elegant and spacious rooms feature high-speed and Wi-Fi Internet, LCD TV, high ceilings and breathtaking panoramic views. A fitness centre with heated swimming pool, gym and dry saunas complete the hotel's on-site leisure facilities.
